A controller account should not be set t: A controller account should not be set to manages multiple stashes. The selected controller is already controlling {{stashId}}
A controller account should not map to a: A controller account should not map to another stash. This selected controller is a stash, controlled by {{bondedId}}
After setting a lock limit, you will rec: After setting a lock limit, you will receive an additional {{KTON}} bonus; if you unlock it in advance within the lock limit, you will be charged a penalty of 3 times the {{KTON}} reward.
Amount to add to the currently bonded fu: Amount to add to the currently bonded funds. This is adjusted using the available funds on the account.
Amount to add to the currently deposit f: Amount to add to the currently deposit funds. This is adjusted using the bonded funds on the account.
An account that is to receive the reward: An account that is to receive the rewards.
Changing the key only takes effect at th: Changing the key only takes effect at the start of the next session. If validating, it must be an ed25519 key.
Changing the key only takes effect at the start of the next session. The input here is generates from the author_rotateKeys command
Display overview information for the sel: Display overview information for the selected validator, including blocks produced.
Filter available candidates based on nam: Filter available candidates based on name, address or short account index.
For fund security, your session key shou: For fund security, your session key should not match your stash key.
Note: Please keep a little {{token}} as: Note: Please keep a little {{token}} as fee
Show only elected for next session: Show only elected for next session
Stash account (do not increase the amoun: Stash account (do not increase the amount at stake)
Stash account (increase the amount at st: Stash account (increase the amount at stake)
The Threshold must be a positive number: The Threshold must be a positive number
The amount of funds to unbond, this is a: The amount of funds to unbond, this is adjusted using the bonded funds on the stash account.
The amount that will be used on a per-va: The amount that will be used on a per-validator basis to calculate rewards for that validator.
The controller is the account that is be: The controller is the account that is be used to control any nominating or validating actions. I will sign this transaction.
The controller is the account that will: The controller is the account that will be used to control any nominating or validating actions. Should not match another stash or controller.
The destination account for any payments: The destination account for any payments as either a nominator or validator
The percentage reward (0-100) that shoul: The percentage reward (0-100) that should be applied for the validator
The specified value is greater than your: The specified value is greater than your free balance. The node will bond the maximum amount available.
The total amount of the stash balance th: The total amount of the stash balance that will be at stake in any forthcoming rounds (should be less than the total amount available)
There are {{payoutsAmount}} unclaimed re: There are {{payoutsAmount}} unclaimed rewards (maximum {{payoutMaxAmount}} rewards per extrinsic, {{tx}} times to receive all rewards)
There is currently an ongoing election f: There is currently an ongoing election for new validator candidates. As such staking operations are not permitted.
This operation will submit the seed via: This operation will submit the seed via an RPC call. Do not perform this operation on a public RPC node, but ensure that the node is local, connected to your validator and secure.
Warning - Changing the controller while: Warning - Changing the controller while validating will modify the associated session account. It is advised to stop validating before changing the controller account.
Your nomination will take effect in the: Your nomination will take effect in the next era. Before that, the POWER may be displayed as 0
available: The amount of tokens that are: available: The amount of tokens that are able to transfer, bond and transfer.
bonded: The amount of tokens that cannot: bonded: The amount of tokens that cannot operated directly but does not have lock limit, which is used to gain voting power and can be taken out at any time (with a 14-day unbonding period) or add lock limit.
locked: The amount of tokens that cannot: locked: The amount of tokens that cannot be operated and has a lock limit, which is used to gain voting power and earn additional KTON rewards.
unbonding: The amount of tokens that has: unbonding: The amount of tokens that has been unlocked but in the unbonding period.
